dt: {bc}to address with expressions of kind wishes, courtesy, or honor
{bc}to give a sign of respect, courtesy, or goodwill to {bc}{sx|greet||}
{bc}to become apparent to (one of the senses)
{bc}to honor (a person, a nation, an event, etc.) by a conventional military or naval ceremony
{bc}to show respect and recognition to (a military superior) by assuming a prescribed position

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}salutare{/it}, from {it}salut-, salus{/it} health, safety, greeting, from {it}salvus{/it} safe, healthy {ma}{mat|safe|}{/ma}
shortdef: to address with expressions of kind wishes, courtesy, or honor
to give a sign of respect, courtesy, or goodwill to : greet
to become apparent to (one of the senses)
